content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSDECOD
      operator: equal_to
      value: DEATH
    - name: DSSTDTC
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: DTHDTC
Match Datasets:
  - Name: DM
    Keys:
      - USUBJID
Core:
  Id: CORE-000034
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when DSSTDTC is not equal to DM.DTHDTC and DSDECOD is
  equal to "DEATH"
Outcome:
  Message: DSSTDTC does not equal DM.DTHDTC, when DSDECOD equals "DEATH".
  Output Variables:
    - DSDECOD
    - DSSTDTC
    - DTHDTC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0069
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO
                  8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in
                  the clinical-trial database.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5.2'
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0069
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO
                  8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in
                  the clinical-trial database.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.3
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5.2'
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0069
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO
                  8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in
                  the clinical-trial database.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.2
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: Raise an error when DSSTDTC is not equal to DM.DTHDTC and DSDECOD is equal to "DEATH"
